identification.notes: The value cannot be calculated on the basis available in vivo data and cannot be fitted using in vitro data.
The value should be chosen depending on specific model conditions.
The value was not identified in the current database version.

The model describes differentiation of na√Øve T helper cells (Th0 in the model) into T helper cells type 2 (Th2), effect of IL-4 on Th2 differentiation, Th2 proliferation, IL-2 effect on Th2 proliferation, production of IL-5, IL-13, IL-10 by Th2.
Thoracic duct lymph flow rate is about 1mL/min (=0.06 L/hour).
The value of parameter describing IL-4 degradation is calculated on the basis of the data on IL-4 half-life in plasma after IL-4 IV administration in humans.
The value was calculated on the basis of data on total CD4 T cells and the percent of Th2 (IL-4 positive) cells.
The value of each cytokine was taken equal to its level in blood serum of healthy subjects.
The value was taken equal to the level of TGFb in blood serum of healthy subjects.
The value of each cytokine was taken equal to its level in blood serum of healthy subjects.
The value was taken equal to number of CTLA-4 molecules per one T cell.
The value was calculated on the basis of data on number of CD86 molecules per one B cell and effect of antigen (LPS) on CD86 expression on B cells.
The value was calculated on the basis of data on number of MHC class II molecules per one iDC cell and effect of antigen (LPS) on MHC class II expression on dendritic cells.
The equation was derived in accordance with zero-order reaction including stimulation and inhibition by other species (if it is presented).
The equation was derived in accordance with first-order reaction including stimulation and inhibition by other species (if it is presented).
Concentration of each surface molecule was described as total concentration on all cells of particular type (for example, CTL, Target cells, APC including B cells and DC) in particular compartment.
Inhibitory effects of species on processes were described by Michaelis-Menten like equations. Stimulatory effects of species on processes were described by linear dependences.
